Class UniversalDispatcher

java.lang.Object
com.dua3.utility.logging.backend.universal.UniversalDispatcher
All Implemented Interfaces:
LogEntryDispatcher
public class UniversalDispatcher extends Object implements LogEntryDispatcher
A centralized dispatcher for handling and processing log events across different logging frameworks.

The CommonDispatcher acts as a bridge between multiple logging APIs, providing unified log event dispatching to registered handlers. It supports the logging frameworks Log4j, SLF4J, Java Util Logging (JUL), and Jakarta Commons Logging (JCL), enabling consistent processing of log events regardless of the source.

The class follows a singleton pattern to ensure a single instance is used throughout the application.

      Default constructor for the CommonDispatcher class.

  • Method Details

    • getInstance

      public static UniversalDispatcher getInstance()
      Provides the singleton instance of the CommonDispatcher.

      This method ensures a single instance of CommonDispatcher is shared across the application using a holder class for lazy initialization.

      Returns:
      the singleton instance of CommonDispatcher

    • addLogEntryHandler

      public void addLogEntryHandler(LogEntryHandler handler)
      Description copied from interface: LogEntryDispatcher
      Adds a handler for log entry events. The handler will be invoked whenever a log entry is received.
      Specified by:
      addLogEntryHandler in interface LogEntryDispatcher
      Parameters:
      handler - The log entry handler to be added.

    • removeLogEntryHandler

      public void removeLogEntryHandler(LogEntryHandler handler)
      Description copied from interface: LogEntryDispatcher
      Removes a previously added log entry handler. The handler will no longer be invoked for any log entries.
      Specified by:
      removeLogEntryHandler in interface LogEntryDispatcher
      Parameters:
      handler - The log entry handler to be removed.

    • setFilter

      public void setFilter(LogEntryFilter filter)
      Description copied from interface: LogEntryDispatcher
      Sets the LogEntryFilter for log entry events.

      Only entries that pass the filter will be dispatched to handlers.

      Specified by:
      setFilter in interface LogEntryDispatcher
      Parameters:
      filter - The filter to be set for log entry events.

    • getLogEntryHandlers

      public Collection<LogEntryHandler> getLogEntryHandlers()
      Description copied from interface: LogEntryDispatcher
      Get the registered log entry handlers. Note that implementations usually hold weak references to the handlers, so unused handlers may already have been removed from the list.
      Specified by:
      getLogEntryHandlers in interface LogEntryDispatcher
      Returns:
      collection containing the registered log entry handlers

    • isEnabledLog4j

      public boolean isEnabledLog4j(String name, org.apache.logging.log4j.Level level, @Nullable org.apache.logging.log4j.Marker marker)
      Determines if Log4j logging is enabled for a specific logger name, level, and optional marker. This method evaluates the logger name, log level, and marker to decide whether logging should proceed.
      Parameters:
      name - the name of the logger to check; must not be null
      level - the Log4j Level to evaluate; must not be null
      marker - an optional Marker associated with the logger; may be null
      Returns:
      true if logging is enabled for the specified logger name, level, and marker, false otherwise

    • isEnabledSlf4j

      public boolean isEnabledSlf4j(org.slf4j.event.Level level)
      Checks if logging is enabled for the provided SLF4J log level.
      Parameters:
      level - the SLF4J logging level to check
      Returns:
      true if logging is enabled for the specified level, false otherwise

    • isEnabled

      public boolean isEnabled(LogLevel logLevel)
      Determines if logging is enabled for a specific LogLevel. This method evaluates the provided log level to determine whether logging should proceed.
      Parameters:
      logLevel - the log level to check; must not be null
      Returns:
      true if logging is enabled for the specified log level, false otherwise

    • dispatchLog4j

      public void dispatchLog4j(String name, org.apache.logging.log4j.Level level, @Nullable org.apache.logging.log4j.Marker marker, org.apache.logging.log4j.message.Message message, @Nullable Throwable t)
      Dispatches a Log4j log event to all registered LogEntryHandler instances. This method determines if the log event should be processed based on the translated log level and forwards the event to handlers enabled for that level.
      Parameters:
      name - the fully qualified class name of the logger emitting the event; must not be null
      level - the Log4j Level of the log event; must not be null
      marker - an optional Marker associated with the log event; may be null
      message - the log message to be formatted and dispatched; must not be null
      t - an optional Throwable associated with the log event; may be null

    • dispatchSlf4j

      public void dispatchSlf4j(String loggerName, org.slf4j.event.Level level, @Nullable org.slf4j.Marker marker, String messagePattern, @Nullable Object @Nullable [] arguments, @Nullable Throwable throwable)
      Dispatches an SLF4J logging event to all registered LogEntryHandler instances. This method determines if the log event should be processed based on the log level and forwards the event to handlers that are enabled for the translated log level.
      Parameters:
      loggerName - the name of the logger emitting the event; must not be null
      level - the SLF4J Level of the log event; must not be null
      marker - an optional Marker associated with the log event; may be null
      messagePattern - the SLF4J-style message pattern to be formatted; must not be null
      arguments - an optional array of arguments for the message pattern; may be null or empty
      throwable - an optional Throwable associated with the log event; may be null

    • dispatchJul

      public void dispatchJul(LogRecord logRecord)
      Dispatches a log event derived from a LogRecord. This method translates the JUL (Java Util Logging) level to the appropriate LogLevel, formats the log message, and forwards the log record to all registered LogEntryHandler instances that are enabled for the translated log level.
      Parameters:
      logRecord - the LogRecord containing the log information; must not be null

    • dispatchJcl

      public void dispatchJcl(String name, LogLevel level, @Nullable Object message, @Nullable Throwable t)
      Dispatches a log event using the JCL (Jakarta Commons Logging) mechanism. The method determines whether the log event should be handled based on its log level and dispatches it to all registered LogEntryHandler instances that are enabled for the specified log level.
      Parameters:
      name - the name of the logger
      level - the log level of the event
      message - the log message to be dispatched; can be null
      t - an optional Throwable associated with the log event; can be null
